Thank you for joining us on this platform to hopefully begin to promote a healthier way of living for yourself and the people around you. As was stated in the preview screen, this application was installed at your own risk, such as the information provided being taken at your own discretion.
Did you know that, generally, the recommended daily calorie intake is 2,000 calories for women and 2,500 for men?*
Yes
No

Thank you for joining us on this platform to hopefully begin to promote a healthier way of living for yourself and the people around you. As was stated in the preview screen, this application was installed at your own risk, such as the information provided being taken at your own discretion.
Did you know that, generally, the recommended daily calorie intake is 2,000 calories for women and 2,500 for men?*
Yes
No
The next questions are likely to contain the requirement for some personal information. This is all anonymous, as well as never stored.
If you had to classify as one or the other; would you sugged you feel you are undereating (not eating enough) or overeating (eating more than you feel you should)?
Undereating
Overeating
Recognising the NHS defined limit of
Use some magic concealment or grab the gold and leg it?
Grab the gold
Use magic

Thinking of all the wide sleeve robes you could buy, you approach the pile of gold. As you make it within a few feet of the gold, the mound growing as more of the cave becomes visible, it stirs suddenly. The gigantic head of a dragon protrudes from the mound of gold, you try to turn back but too late! The dragon having spotted you, raises its head and decimates you with it\'s fiery breath. Your body falls to ash, a fitting death for a greedy thief.

Using the information you have provided me, it is is very unlikely that you are overeating. However it is never as easy as just diagnosing it. If you feel as if it is having majorly adverse affects on you, then booking to see your GP (General Practioner) would most likely be thes best course of action. However, i can still provide you with some hopefully helpful information.
Would you like some advice that may help you control what you are eating?
Yes
No (finish)
You consider yourself to be \"overeating\". In most cases, it is going to be unlikely that you are overeating.
Do you consume around or more than 3000 (three thousand) calories throughout your average day? (e.g. 7am-8pm)
Yes, i consume around that or more
No, i consume less than the amount

Great, now that we have that established, I can provide you with some accurate information. Being Male, the NHS suggests that you should be attaining a diet of 2500 calories a day. Often people recognise a 500 calorie margin above and below for those who are considered to be either cutting (trying to lose weight) or bulking (attempting to gain weight)
From the calorie consumption options provided below, could you please select the one most accurate for yourself

Great, now that we have that established, I can provide you with some accurate information. Being Female, the NHS suggests that you should be attaining a diet of 2000 calories a day. Often people recognise a 500 calorie margin above and below for those who are considered to be either cutting (trying to lose weight) or bulking (attempting to gain weight)
From the calorie consumption options provided below, could you please select the one most accurate for yourself

From what you have told me, you believe that you are \"undereating\". The concept of undereating is one that can be very serious to both your physical and mental health.. We are unable to give any further advice on this matter, but highly recommend that you consult professional help (whether it be your General Practioner or specialised psycological help). With the development of this app, we could be adding medically backed support, so check back in the future!

Great, now that we have that established, I can provide you with some accurate information. Being Male, the NHS suggests that you should be attaining a diet of 2500 calories a day. Often people recognise a 500 calorie margin above and below for those who are considered to be either cutting (trying to lose weight) or bulking (attempting to gain weight)

Maybe before you go ahead with this tool, it could benefit you to read up on the NHS\'s literature regarding calorie intake and the healthy limits. It is linked here: https://bit.ly/37mkV7A
